intro: Tithymalus regis-jubae, commonly known as the royal tithymalus, is a species of flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its foliage is usually covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, which helps to retain moisture and protect against harsh weather. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
